The Buddha said:
Good sons!
Sentient beings create karma in four ways.
First, the present retribution - creating extremely good or evil karma in this body and receiving it in this body.
This is called the present retribution. Second, the retribution of the next life - creating karma in this body and receiving it in the next life.
This is called the retribution of the next life. Third, the retribution of the later life - creating karma in this body.
Next, not yet receiving it,
but receiving it after the second or third life.
This is called the retribution of the later life. Fourth, no retribution - such as indeterminate karma. This karma without retribution also has four types.
First, the time is fixed but the retribution is indeterminate - this is determined in the three periods and does not change.

Because there is something that can be changed in karma, the retribution is indeterminate. The second is when the retribution is definite but the time is indefinite. Because the power of karma determines the retribution, it cannot be changed.

However, there is something that can be changed in time, so the time is indefinite. The third is when both the time and the retribution are definite. Because the karma is definite, the time of retribution is also definite. The fourth is when both the time and the retribution are indefinite. Because the karma is indeterminate, the time and retribution are also indefinite. Sentient beings perform karma with completeness or incompleteness.
If one first thinks and then acts, it is called complete performance.
If one directly acts without first thinking,
it is called incomplete performance.
There are also those who perform incompletely.
It means that the karma has been done but the retribution is indefinite.
There are also those who have done and completed the performance.
It means that having done the karma, one will definitely receive the retribution.
There are also those who have done but not completed the performance.
Although the retribution is definite, the time is indefinite.
There are also those who have done and completed the performance.
Both the time and retribution are definite.
There are also those who have done but not completed the performance.
Upholding precepts and right views.
There are also those who have already committed [evil] and are also complete.
Violating precepts and having wrong views.
There are also those who have already committed [evil] but are incomplete, and regret it at the three times [of past, present, and future].
There are also those who have already committed [evil] and are complete.
They do not regret it at the three times.
As with evil,
it is the same with good.
